StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: GEDI:A Developmental Model of Gene-Environment Interplay in SUDs

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Funding support for the work was provided through NIDA (R01DA024413). We gratefully acknowledge the help of the Laboratory for Comparative Human Biology at Emory University and its Director, Carol Worthman, PhD., of our colleagues on the Gene-Environment-Development Initiative, and to the study participants.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: The deidentified datasets have been consented for submission to the NIH data repository and for subsequent sharing for research purposes. The plan for genotype and phenotype data to be submitted is consistent with applicable HIPAA regulations and Duke University Health System’s IRB policy. Date Use Limitation: Participants consented to the use of their samples for future research studies to identify genes that may be related to mental health functioning. Number of participants in this consent group: 1192. Number with successful DNA extraction and genotyping: 782.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Addiction and Mental Health, IRB, GSO, RD)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-ADMH-IRB-GSO-RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Addiction and Mental Health and related disorders. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only.
